bioghist.p: The Auxiliary Union of Pittsburgh and Vicinity of the General Union for Promoting the Observance of the Christian Sabbath held its first meeting on March 2, 1830. "The great means employed by this society to effect their design shall be the influence of personal example, of moral suasion, with arguments drawn from the oracle of God, from the existing laws of the country, appeals to the heart and conscience of men and fervent supplication to the Lord of the Sabbath."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a volume of minutes of monthly meetings of the Auxiliary Union of Pittsburgh and Vicinity of the General Union for Promoting the Observance of the Christian Sabbath, 1830-1832. The volume includes the organization's constitution, and receipts, 1835 to 1867, for moneys given by Daniel Elliott and other members of the General Assembly's Board of Education to students at the Western Theological Seminary.
